content:
Which of the following is NOT true:
W) any foreign substance added to water will cause a freezing point drop
X) a nonvolatile solute raises the boiling point of a solvent
Y) methane has a higher boiling point than ethane
Z) freezing point depression is a colligative property
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: Y) METHANE HAS A HIGHER BOILING POINT THAN ETHANE

content:
According to standard chemical nomenclature, what is the formula
for aluminum bicarbonate?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following types of biological molecules is digested by
trypsin:
W) proteins
X) nucleic acids
Y) carbohydrates
Z) lipids
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Name all of the following 4 choices that are typically considered
human autoimmune dysfunctions: Rheumatoid arthritis; Lupus; shingles; Down’s syndrome
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS; LUPUSHigh School Round 11 Page 1

content:
Which of the following is closest to the radius of a hydrogen
nucleus:
W) 1 micrometer
X) 1 angstrom
Y) 1 picometer
Z) 1 femtometer
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Consider a planet where g equals 5.0 meters per second squared.
Ignoring friction, if an object started from rest, how far would it fall vertically off a cliff in 4.0
seconds, giving your answer in standard SI units?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: 40 METERS (must give units)(Solution: d = ½ × at2 = ½ × 5× 42 = 40 meters)

content:
The graph of the relation y = − (25−x2) is a:
W) circle
X) semi-circle
Y) parabola
Z) straight line
subject: MATH

content:
If y varies directly as x and z, and y = 12 when x = 4 and z = 5, find y
when x = 10 and z = 20:
subject: MATH
answer: 120(Solution: y= kxz; 12 = k(4)(5); k = 3/5; y = 3/5(10)(20) = 120)High School Round 11 Page 2

content:
What is the third most common gas naturally found in the
Earth’s clean, dry atmosphere?
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
The Earth’s greenhouse effect is primarily caused by which
of the following:
W) incoming solar ultraviolet light is absorbed by the ozone layer
X) outgoing infrared solar radiation is trapped by the lower atmosphere
Y) incoming infrared solar radiation is trapped by the magnetic field
Z) outgoing X-rays are absorbed by the troposphere and reflected to the Earth’s surface
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: X) OUTGOING INFRARED SOLAR RADIATION IS TRAPPED BY THE LOWERATMOSPHERE

content:
Ed the entomologist is setting up mosquito traps in a
farmer’s field in Nebraska. Which of the following would be the BEST mosquito attractant to
ensure he traps the greatest number and variety of mosquitoes:
W) oxygen
X) nitrogen
Y) dry ice
Z) methane
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: Y) DRY ICE(Solution: mosquitoes attracted to CO )2

content:
Rounded to the nearest whole number, convert 3,000
meters per second into kilometers per hour:
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is LEAST accurate:
W) most stars visible to the unaided eye are part of the Milky Way galaxy
X) there are 88 constellations officially recognized by the IAU
Y) a red supergiant has a hotter surface than our Sun
Z) the constellation Leo is located within 9º of the ecliptic
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Y) A RED SUPERGIANT HAS A HOTTER SURFACE THAN OUR SUN

content:
Which of the following is NOT true:
W) the core of a red supergiant is hotter than the core of a main sequence K-type star
X) helium flash is something that occurs in red giant stars
Y) the Pleiades is an open star cluster
Z) there is more lithium than carbon in the universe
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Z) THERE IS MORE LITHIUM THAN CARBON IN THE UNIVERSE

content:
Carbon monoxide, or CO, will be adsorbed (read as: ADD-
sorbed) onto the surface of which of the following metals the MOST strongly:
W) iron
X) nickel
Y) cobalt
Z) gold
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Arrange the following 3 choices in order of increasing bond
energies: O ; N ; F
2 2 2
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: F ; O ; N2 2 2High School Round 11 Page 4

content:
At which of the following pH levels will human pepsin be most
active:
W) 2
X) 4
Y) 6
Z) 8
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
What is the most plentiful class of immunoglobulins in human
plasma?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
What constant is given as the amount of electric charge per mole of
electrons?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Which of the following best describes the direction of the force on
an electron moving through a magnetic field:
W) opposite to the direction of the velocity
X) the same direction as the velocity
Y) the same direction as the magnetic field
Z) perpendicular to the magnetic field
subject: PHYSICS
answer: Z) PERPENDICULAR TO THE MAGNETIC FIELDHigh School Round 11 Page 5

content:
Which of the following is a second quadrant angle in standard
position:
W) 500º
X) –180º
Y) –680º
Z) 930º
subject: MATH

content:
Giving your answer in simplest radical form, rationalize the denominator
−3 2
of the following expression:
( 3 − 5)
3 6 +3 10 3
subject: MATH

content:
Which of the following minerals occurs in small amounts
in many igneous rocks, is black and shiny, often occurs in small hexagonal blocks, and is soft with
good cleavage:
W) biotite
X) olivine
Y) plagioclase
Z) quartz
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is NOT true of basalt and gabbro:
W) they formed from magma at the same temperature
X) they are derived from basaltic magma
Y) they formed from magma with the same silica content
Z) they are both intrusive igneous rocks
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: Z) THEY ARE BOTH INTRUSIVE IGNEOUS ROCKS(Solution: basalt = extrusive; gabbro = intrusive)High School Round 11 Page 6

content:
A standard rain gauge consists of a metal canister open
at the top in which a funnel drains rainwater into a narrow cylinder. Each time they are deployed to
the field, a small amount of light oil is added to the cylinder. This is done to:
W) deter birds from drinking the water
X) stop the canister from oxidizing
Y) prevent the growth of blue-green algae
Z) prevent water evaporation
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is a widely-used analgesic and
antipyretic medication which is not considered an NSAID (read as: en-say’d):
W) acetylcysteine
X) acetaminophen
Y) acetylsalicylic acid
Z) ibuprophen
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is LEAST likely to occur for a
stargazer observing from mid-northern latitudes during summer months:
W) the planet Venus passing within a few degrees of the Moon a few hours after sunset
X) the Moon at perigee
Y) the planet Saturn passing with 5 degrees of the Moon
Z) the planet Mercury within 10 degrees of the zenith
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Z) THE PLANET MERCURY WITHIN 10 DEGREES OF THE ZENITH

content: Through how many degrees does the Earth rotate in 8 hours?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
The molal (read as: moe-lahl) is a concentration unit that is
most appropriately used in experimental designs that determine:
W) freezing point depression
X) osmotic pressure
Y) density
Z) vapor pressure lowering
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
A 4.0 gram sample of calcium chloride contains 6.0 × 1022
cations. Giving your answer in scientific notation to the nearest whole number, determine the
number of anions in 2 grams of CaCl . Assume the atomic mass of calcium is 40 and chloride is 35.
2
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following is the main target of bacteria by the
antibiotic penicillin:
W) energy production
X) DNA synthesis
Y) cell wall synthesis
Z) translation
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
What is the most common term for the form of protection when a
non-poisonous frog has the same appearance as a poisonous frog?
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: BATESIAN MIMICRY (ACCEPT: MIMICRY or WARNING MIMICRY)(DO NOT ACCEPT: MULLERIAN MIMICRY)High School Round 11 Page 8

content:
During positron emission, which of the following most likely
occurs:
W) a proton changes to an electron
X) a proton changes to a neutron
Y) a neutron changes to an electron
Z) a neutron changes to a proton
subject: PHYSICS
answer: X) A PROTON CHANGES TO A NEUTRON

content:
Name all of the following 4 isotopes that release energy if they
undergo fission: helium-4; hydrogen-2; uranium-235; iron-56
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Identify the type of conic section represented by the equation,
x2 + y2 + 10y + 16 = 0:
subject: MATH

content:
Find the area, in centimeters squared and in simplest radical form, of a
regular or equilateral triangle whose circumcircle has a radius of 8 centimeters:
subject: MATH
answer: 48 3(Solution: apothem = 4; perimeter = (8 3)(3); A = ½(4)(24 3) = 48 3 cm2)High School Round 11 Page 9

content:
What type of fog frequently forms in valleys when the wind
is light and the ground cools until the dew point is reached?
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: RADIATION FOG (ACCEPT: RADIATION or RADIATIONAL)(Solution: brought about by radiational cooling)

content:
Giving your answer as morning, afternoon, evening, or
night, when does most radiational cooling occur for any location in the U.S.?
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content: What is the sling psychrometer used to measure?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
From which of the following is camphor derived:
W) petroleum distillate
X) the wood of an evergreen tree of the laurel family
Y) the bark of a fir tree from the Mediterranean
Z) the seed pod of the camphor herb
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: X) THE WOOD OF AN EVERGREEN TREE OF THE LAUREL FAMILYHigh School Round 11 Page 10

content:
As seen from the Earth, what planet has the smallest maximum
eastern elongation?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Choosing from noon, sunset, midnight or sunrise, at what time
of the day does a new Moon rise for an observer at mid-northern latitudes in September?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
What is the electron capacity in each of the 4 sublevels s, p, d,
and f, respectively?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
A sample of oxygen gas is collected over water at 14ºC.
Knowing that the vapor pressure of water at 14ºC is 1.6 kilopascals, and that the pressure of the
resultant mixture is 120 kilopascals, find the pressure, to the first decimal place, exerted by the dry
oxygen alone:
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: 118.4(Solution: P = P – P = 120 kPa – 1.6 kPa = 118.4 kPa)dry t wvHigh School Round 11 Page 11

content:
What cell in the peripheral blood is the immediate precursor of the
macrophage?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Name all of the following 4 cells that are leukocytes:
neutrophil; basophil; melanocyte; macrophage
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
As opposed to spontaneous emission, what is the type of emission,
first theorized by Albert Einstein, where a photon interacts with an atom’s electron which, when it
returns to a ground state, emits a coherent photon?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Order the following 4 choices from the one with the LOWEST
temperature to the one with the HIGHEST temperature:
copper freezes; water boils; solar corona; lead melts
subject: PHYSICS
answer: WATER BOILS; LEAD MELTS; COPPER FREEZES; SOLAR CORONAHigh School Round 11 Page 12

content: Solve the following equation for x: 27 ×2(x2−2) = 221
subject: MATH
answer: 4 OR –4 (ACCEPT: x = ±4)(Solution: 7 + x2 – 2 = 21; x = 4 and –4)High School Round 11 Page 13
